review_blob: Still undecided about which is the greatest London IPA. Kernel Citra, Brodies Citra or Redchurch Great Eastern? Anyway, I think this has to be a regular for the Kernel. His best IPA so far and I reckon he knows it. Cant imagine how better it can get.
beer_name: The Kernel India Pale Ale Citra

review_blob: What is the best IPA in the UK? Magic 8 ball, Great Eastern IPA or Kernel Citra??? No, I can decide either. But this is just wonderful. Bottle conditioned to give you that London feel. Lovely foam and sometimes can be a bit lively. Lovely drop.
beer_name: Redchurch Great Eastern India Pale Ale

review_blob: Is this beer better because of its exclusivity? Maybe. I remember trying the most easy drinking 11.5% beer I can remember. I tried so many beers in Bruge that week but this was the best. Wonderfully sweet and very acquired. Trying this before or after a IPA or stout would make this foul. But after that 3 sip, you are in heaven! Definitely in my top 5.
I love this beer. Reminds me of that first taste of Coconut Porter. That charred taste is just wonderful. The smokiness is so well balanced. Brains greatest smoked porter? Yes, I think so.

This is one of the best beers the "Kernel" has produced. For me its up there with his Citra and Imperial Brown Stout. The only reason I cant give it a perfect score is because the IBS is getting the same whisky treatment and I am confident it is going to be the best beer I have ever tasted. This has the perfect balance of sweetness and bitterness and a lovely warmth coming from the whisky. And its not too rich in taste so it goes past being a beer anymore. Bravo!
beer_name: The Kernel India Pale Ale Double SCCANS (Whisky Barrel)
